CompletionItem.name: XMLELEMENT
CompletionItem.Documentation:
The XMLELEMENT function is the basic unit for turning column data into XML fragments. 
XMLELEMENT 
 ( NAME  identifier
    [, XML_attributes_clause ]
    [, value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
      [, value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
    ]...
 )

CompletionItem.name: XMLATTRIBUTES
CompletionItem.Documentation:
The XMLATRIBUTES function converts column data into attributes of the parent element. The function call should contain one or more columns in a comma separated list. The attribute names will match the column names using the default uppercase unless an alias is used. 
XMLATTRIBUTES
  (value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
    [, value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
      ]...
  )

CompletionItem.name: XMLAGG
CompletionItem.Documentation:
The XMLAGG function allows is to aggregate these separate fragments into a single fragment. 
XMLAGG(XMLType_instance [ order_by_clause ])

CompletionItem.name: XMLFOREST
CompletionItem.Documentation:
XMLForest converts each of its argument parameters to XML, and then returns an XML fragment that is the concatenation of these converted arguments. 
XMLFOREST
  ( value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
    [, value_expr [ AS c_alias ]
      ]...
  )

CompletionItem.name: XMLCONCAT
CompletionItem.Documentation:
XMLConcat takes as input a series of XMLType instances, concatenates the series of elements for each row, and returns the concatenated series. XMLConcat is the inverse of XMLSequence. 
XMLCONCAT(XMLType_instance [, XMLType_instance ]...)

CompletionItem.name: XMLCOMMENT
CompletionItem.Documentation:
XMLComment generates an XML comment using an evaluated result of value_expr. The value_expr must resolve to a string. It cannot contain two consecutive dashes (hyphens). 
XMLCOMMENT ( value_expr )

CompletionItem.name: XMLSERIALIZE
CompletionItem.Documentation:
XMLSerialize creates a string or LOB containing the contents of value_expr.
  • If you specify DOCUMENT, then the value_expr must be a valid XML document.
  • If you specify CONTENT, then the value_expr need not be a singly rooted XML document. However it must be valid XML content.
  • The datatype specified can be a string type (VARCHAR2 or VARCHAR, but not NVARCHAR or NVARCHAR2) or CLOB . The default is CLOB.
XMLSERIALIZE
  ( { DOCUMENT | CONTENT } value_expr
      [ AS datatype ]
  )

CompletionItem.name: XMLPARSE
CompletionItem.Documentation:
DB2

The XMLPARSE function parses the argument as an XML document and returns an XML value. 
     
XMLPARSE
   (DOCUMENT value_expr 
             { STRIP WHITESPACE | PRESERVE WHITESPACE }
    )

Oracle

XMLParse parses and generates an XML instance from the evaluated result of value_expr. The value_expr must resolve to a string. If value_expr resolves to null, then the function returns null. a character string or BLOB
  • If you specify DOCUMENT, then value_expr must resolve to a singly rooted XML document.
  • If you specify CONTENT, then value_expr must resolve to a valid XML value.
  • When you specify WELLFORMED, you are guaranteeing that value_expr resolves to a well-formed XML document, so the database does not perform validity checks to ensure that the input is well formed.
XMLPARSE
  ({ DOCUMENT | CONTENT } value_expr [ WELLFORMED ]
  )
